Container.Name: HandBrake
Container.Overview: HandBrake is a tool for converting video from nearly any format to a selection of modern, widely supported codecs. [br][br] The GUI of the application is accessed through a modern web browser (no installation or configuration needed on client side) or via any VNC client. A fully automated mode is also available: drop files into a watch folder and let HandBrake process them without any user interaction. Also, being based on Alpine Linux, size of this container is very small (less than 80MB in download size). [br][br][span][/span] For a complete documentation of this container, see [a href="https://github.com/jlesage/docker-handbrake/blob/master/README.md"] https://github.com/jlesage/docker-handbrake/blob/master/README.md[/a].

Container.Changes:
[font size=4][center]HandBrake Change Log[/center][/font] [font size=3][b]v1.3.0[/b][/font] (2017-06-21) - Now using baseimage v1.4.2, which brings the following changes (from last used version): - Switched to Alpine Linux 3.6. - Associate the application's icon to a unique version to avoid browser cache issues. - Fixed prefix of some service related messages. - Added support for supplying supplementary groups of the application. - Improved process startup and shutdown. - When container is stopped or restarted, processes are now terminated gracefully and in proper order. This allow the GUI application to execute its termination routine. - No more error messages when container is stopped or restarted.
[font size=3][b]v1.2.0[/b][/font] (2017-05-31) - Added support for post-conversion hook.
[font size=3][b]v1.1.4[/b][/font] (2017-05-30) - Now using baseimage v1.3.2, which brings the following changes: - Fixed password modal window not showing up when required.
[font size=3][b]v1.1.3[/b][/font] (2017-05-26) - Watch folder: Fixed issue where, after a first successful conversion, conversion of next available video files would not start. - Renamed the 'Watch Folder' service to 'Automatic Video Converter'.
[font size=3][b]v1.1.2[/b][/font] (2017-05-24) - Watch folder: Changed the way files being transferred are detected. Method used previously was not working properly in all cases.
[font size=3][b]v1.1.1[/b][/font] (2017-05-24) - Watch folder: temporarily skip files being accessed/transferred. - Watch folder: improved robustness.
[font size=3][b]v1.1.0[/b][/font] (2017-05-23) - Watch folder: properly support filenames containing spaces. - Watch folder: added support for symbolic links. - HandBrake debug can now be enabled via the HANDBRAKE_DEBUG environment variable. - Take ownership of the `/output` folder. - Added the ability to remove video source files from the watch folder after successfully conversion.
[font size=3][b]v1.0.1[/b][/font] (2017-05-18) - The watch folder is now monitored without inotify for better compatibility.
[font size=3][b]v1.0.0[/b][/font] (2017-05-18) - Initial release.

Config.Name: Config Directory
Config.Description: This is where the application stores its configuration, log and any files needing persistency.<br>Container path: /config

Config.Name: Storage
Config.Description: This location contains files from your host that need to be accessible by the application.<br>Container path: /storage

Config.Name: Watch Directory
Config.Description: This is the watch folder of the automatic video converter. Any video copied into this folder will be automatically converted by HandBrake.<br>Container path: /watch

Config.Name: Output Directory
Config.Description: This is the default output folder for converted videos. Also used by the automatic video converter.<br>Container path: /output

Config.Name: User ID
Config.Description: ID of the user the application runs as.

Config.Name: Group ID
Config.Description: ID of the group the application runs as.

Config.Name: Display Width
Config.Description: Width (in pixels) of the application's window.

Config.Name: Display Height
Config.Description: Height (in pixels) of the application's window.

Config.Name: Niceness (priority)
Config.Description: Priority at which the application should run. A niceness value of -20 is the highest priority and 19 is the lowest priority.<br><b>NOTE:</b> Setting a negative value requires additional permissions. Thus, <i><b>--cap-add=SYS_NICE</b></i> must be added in <i>Extra Parameters</i> (shown when <i>Advanced View</i> is enabled).

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Preset
Config.Description: Preset used by the automatic video converter. Name of all available presets can be seen via the HandBrake GUI.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Format
Config.Description: Video container format used by the automatic video converter for output files. This is typically the video filename extension.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Keep Source Files
Config.Description: Set to 0 to remove successfully converted videos from the watch folder, 1 to keep them.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Source File Stable Time
Config.Description: Time during which properties (e.g. size, time, etc) of a video file in the watch folder need to remain the same. This is to avoid processing a file that is being copied.

Config.Name: WEB Port for GUI
Config.Description: Port used to access the application's GUI via the web interface.

Config.Name: VNC Port for GUI
Config.Description: Port used to access the application's GUI via the VNC protocol.<br>Make sure this port is equal to the WEB GUI port + 100.
